questions.question_text:
The project is in stage 3. Zero time tolerance has been given for this stage. When checking progress, the project manager noticed that the checkpoint report from the external supplier of the 'e-learning course' is late. As work package progress information is missing, the project manager has decided to raise an exception report.
Is this an appropriate action, and why?

choices.C: No, because the project manager should check the operations and maintenance interfaces in the work package first.
choices.D: No, because the team plan should be discussed with the supplier to check whether work will be completed on time.
choices.B: Yes, because there is zero time tolerance for this stage the checkpoint report must be delivered on time.
choices.A: Yes, because an exception report should be used to request guidance on how this situation should be handled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Rectified my previous answer. 
Option D is correct as the Project manager needs to discuss this with team manager.

Selected Answer: A
The appropriate answer to the question is A, "Yes, because an exception report should be used to request guidance on how this situation should be handled."
An exception report is a document that highlights any issues or concerns that may impact the project's success. It is used to notify the project board and seek guidance on how to handle the situation. 
B is NOT the correct answer as zero tolerance means product should be delivered on time not the checkpoint report.
D is NOT the correct answer as Project manager is not supposed to check the team plan from a external supplier.

comments.content: while option B is not entirely incorrect, option A is more comprehensive and accurately reflects the PRINCE2 methodology’s approach to handling such situations. It’s not just about enforcing deadlines, but also about managing exceptions and seeking guidance when tolerances are forecasted to be exceeded. So, option A is the most appropriate response in this scenario.

discussion.content:
A

As there is zero time tolerance for this stage, the checkpoint report must be delivered on time. Therefore, the project manager should raise an exception report to request guidance on how this situation should be handled

Option A is correct - Discuss the situation with project assurance. 
Refer 18.4.1 in the manual. 
Consult with project assurance as to whether any extra reviewers are required and ensure that the quality register is updated accordingly.

Updating the quality register with these concerns [C] is not the appropriate action in this situation, as the quality register is used to record the quality criteria and standards that will be used to judge the quality of the project's products. questions.question_text:
MANAGING PRODUCT DELIVERY -
Stage 2 is in progress. While producing the team plan, the team manager responsible for the work package to develop the 'classroom-based training material' discovered that the representatives assigned to check the products were unsuitable.
Which action should the team manager take in response?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Agreed.
B. Yes, because the team manager should agree the limits within which the work is to be completed.
"within the current stage tolerance." so B

choices.B: Yes, because the team manager should agree the limits within which the work is to be completed.
choices.D: No, because the use of the stage time tolerance should be authorized by the project board.
choices.A: Yes, because the team manager should set the time required to complete a work package.
choices.C: No, because the work package, defined by the project manager, should not be changed.

questions.question_text:
The work package to produce the 'updated corporate quality procedures' was created during stage 3. Before accepting the work package, the team manager produces the team plan and finds that the expected delivery date is unrealistic. As a result, the project manager agrees an extra two weeks to complete the work package, within the current stage tolerance. The work package is then accepted by the team manager.
Is this an appropriate application of the 'manage product delivery' process, and why?
Which of the following is NOT a trigger for the project manager to authorize a work package?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D) Reporting highlights - This refers to the regular reporting of project progress and highlights. While reporting may highlight potential issues or progress, it does not trigger the authorization of work packages. The work package authorization is based on the need for action, not on general reporting. Therefore, this is not a trigger.
B - corrective action

B

Corrective action is not a trigger for the project manager to authorize a work package. Corrective action is taken when there is a deviation from the plan or when a problem arises that needs to be addressed

questions.question_text: Which activity is responsible for updating the stage plan with actual during Controlling a Stage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Coulc be A or B 
BUT Both activities can involve updating the Stage Plan, but "Review the Stage Status" has the broader and ultimate responsibility for ensuring that the Stage Plan is fully up-to-date, making it the correct answer in most PRINCE2 contexts. A Review of a work package MAY casue an update to the stage plan

Selected Answer: B
17.4.2 Review work package status
Update the stage plan for the current management stage with actuals to date, forecasts and adjustments.

One of the key activities in the Controlling a Stage process is to review the status of the work packages . Work packages are the smallest units of work in PRINCE2, and they are assigned to team members to complete. By reviewing the status of the work packages, the project manager can gather information on the actual progress made and update the stage plan accordingly.
